DOC.brief_summary: This study design establish clinical evidence effect Robot-Assisted upper arm training Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation upper limb function subacute stroke patient . - Purpose : elucidate effect Robot-Assisted upper arm training Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation upper limb function stroke patient compare conventional occupational therapy - Subjects : total 99 patient stroke whose upper limb function impair - Intervention : 4 week therapy ( 5 day per week ) - Studies : upper limb functional assessment ( FMA , MFT , WMFT ) , computerized motion analysis - Evaluation plan : 1 ) pre-intervention , 2 ) post-2 week intervention , 3 ) post-4 week intervention , 4 ) 4 week end intervention
DOC.brief_title: Combined Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation Robot-Assisted Upper Arm Training Subacute Stroke Patients
DOC.criteria: Upper FMA 738 Hemiplegic patient within 6months stroke onset male female , 20 year old Patients cognitive impairment unable comply protocolrequired procedure Quadriplegic double hemiplegic patient Patients musculoskeletal disease , peripheral nerve disease upper extremity Patients low motor neuron disease Patients perform rTMS Pregnant woman
